full_text: @RoryHearne @RIAdawson @OireachtasNews @MaynoothUni And I am really looking forward to working wirh you Rory!
Have to admit to watching this more than once - @MollyMEP doing us proud ! #morewomen #womeninpolitics https://t.co/JdogrhMF5e

We’re very lucky to have such a respected advocate for our environmental heritage representing us in Wexford - @KarinDubsky has done pioneering work in advocating for our shores and seas - who better to represent a county such amazing beaches! #WantGreenVoteGreen #MoreWomen https://t.co/Wuoh0d9CsA
Fabulous community spirit as always in @sttiernanscs ! #tinytales  #dundrum #balally #sandyford #ballinteer https://t.co/XuHJI1eKKL

Cork deserves a Green voice in the Dáil - for better public transport, real action to protect the city from the climate crisis, and for urban policies that can rebuild a real sense of community, please vote for @oliver_moran on Friday. #WantGreenVoteGreen https://t.co/oGxB6cx050

As one of the youngest and fastest growing constituencies in the country, Dublin Fingal needs a Green voice in the Dáil to push for more public transport, cycling infrastructure, and more school and creche spaces - please vote for @joefingalgreen this Friday! #WantGreenVoteGreen https://t.co/WaANqsWTGv
Please #Vótáil1 for @TheKavOfficial in this Friday's #byelections2019 for a real Green voice for Dublin Mid West! #WantGreenVoteGreen https://t.co/NNy5gfaRy4

.@BoyhanVictor & myself met Barbara O Connell of @ABIIreland ,Theresa Anderson @IrelandCheshire & @KOMRehab this morning - members of @tdac_ireland who are seeking a  new & secure future for the vital services they provide .Thanks to @SenatorJDolan for organising the event. https://t.co/wdD96NoVH1

We need to reject the politics of division. I spoke on the Week in Politics last Sunday of how public representatives must be cognisant that consequences stem and flow from utterances  or comments made by us and there is no room for language of intolerance or hostility. https://t.co/ZOd99J7gA2

Delighted to see my good friend @LaoiseKelharpo being awarded Musician of the Year Gradam Ceoil by @TG4TV.  Well deserved recognition for an incredibly gifted musician & amazing ambassador for an ceol traidisiúnta. Comhghairdeas ó chroí mo chara dhílis! #gaeilge #womeninmusic https://t.co/7lI3ztvLmP
Well done @oboyleconal! Opening remarks as articulate and passionate as any I've heard in the Dáil chamber. #Dáil100 #YouthAssembly https://t.co/p3EYoqDP2I

Today is #WorldPrematurityDay. I was delighted when my motion to give mothers of premature babies additional maternity leave passed in the Dáil - but there’s still so much we need to do; we urgently need to increase space in our maternity hospitals for these babies. https://t.co/PbcTqj9cTj

People with disabilities and their families deserve to be consulted on decisions that will have such an effect on their ability to access respite and holiday breaks - well done to @savecuisle and @Julie_ODonoghue for rallying around a service that has done great work for 20 years https://t.co/cOy4REHOWB

@ThomasCurran11 @greenparty_ie @AlanHurleyArt @FinianMcGrathTD @savecuisle Hi Thomas, I very much support the @savecuisle campaign and hope to be at the protest today with my colleague @Julie_ODonoghue. People with disabilities deserve to have their voices heard rather than have policies forced upon them.

@farrellybrian We need public housing on public land, and Gov needs to require developers to provide a much more diverse mix of housing than developer-led preference of primarily high-end buy-to-lets.
@farrellybrian 2/3 The SHD process has resulted in planning permissions – but proportionately very little actual housing construction: https://t.co/3ISMCJDHPF

@farrellybrian 1/3 Hi Brian, thanks very much for taking the time to reply to my letter.  We do need more housing desperately - but what I'm objecting to is Gov's continued over-reliance on the private market and acceding to developer-led policy demands like the SHD process is.

.@Costellop and I wrote to Minister Ross yesterday to ask for 4 key urgent actions on cyclist safety - it's long past time for us to protect vulnerable road users. #Allocate4Cycling #iBikeActionWeek #StopKillingCyclists https://t.co/Ei1xeYJMMe

Apartment owners spoke today at the Oireachtas Housing Commitmee of the nightmare they have been living since defects were discovered in their homes & appealed again to Government to stop ignoring them. Well done to the @AllianceDefects for voicing their concerns. https://t.co/XQA7n62CtB
Owners of defective apartments appeal for State help  https://t.co/quW3anqWKw

Delighted to attend the launch of the @PMVTrust / @DublinCityUni Educational Gaps and Future Solutions report yesterday. The report sets out 7 key recommendations to improve young people’s educational experiences and reduce the risks of homelessness. https://t.co/SgW4ZsHp3a

There has been enough carnage on our roads. It's time for the Government to seriously invest in safe cycling infrastructure #iBikeActionWeek #StopKillingCyclists #DailDieIn @dlrcycling @dublincycling @IBikeAlerts @IBIKEDublin https://t.co/WO2NXbuGC9

The @greenparty_ie team in the Oireachtas grew today as @pippa_hackett begins her term as a Senator! It’s wonderful to have such an amazing advocate for farmers and rural Ireland and also another member of the Women’s Caucus! #MoreWomen https://t.co/ZwFev271PQ

It’s so important for workers to be able to switch off and have proper time for themselves and their familes. Very happy to support the @fsuireland Right to Disconnect petition, I hope you will too & will sign here: https://t.co/P87omB8D0Z

Wonderful memories of sitting down with my late parents every week to watch the legendary Gay Byrne on The Late Late Show. Ní bheidh a leithéid arís ann. Ar dheis Dé go raibh a anam dílis #GayByrne https://t.co/r77Ld12hlR

Last year the Taoiseach spoke of how he wasn't proud of Ireland being a Climate laggard.This week the Taoiseach spoke of the  'pluses and minuses of Climate Change ' He sees some ''benefits" to #ClimateChange .That train of thought helps explain why Ireland is a climate laggard! https://t.co/k3pwP6Q6eg

Where are the supports for students in #Budget2020? No support for SUSI, or anything to address the lack of student housing. Our universities are plunging down the rankings, as our students are grappling with some of the highest fees & cost of living in Europe. #BreakTheBarriers
